issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
The hive sql is:
{quote}
        select working_experience,count(*) 
        from search 
        where 
            log_date = 20140825 and 
            ua not rlike '^.*(HttpClient|Jakarta|scrapy|bot|spider|wget).*$' and
             working_experience in ('不限','应届毕业生','1年以下','1-3年','3-5年','5-10年','10年以上','') 
        group by working_experience
{quote}

*Execute the sql a short time on the same environment(data not change) twice, the first is run sucessful and print the right result , but the second is error:*
    
The error is:
{quote}
    Diagnostic Messages for this Task: 
    / by zero
{quote}

*The first （successful）, The whole info is:*
{quote}
> select working_experience,count(*) from search where log_date = 20140825 and ua not rlike '^.*(HttpClient|Jakarta|scrapy|bot|spider|wget).*$' and working_experience in ('不限','应届毕业生','1年以下','1-3年','3-5年','5-10年','10年以上','') group by working_experience;

fields.summary: Execute the same sql first sucessful, but the second error "/ by zero"
fields.environment:
CentOS release 6.2 (Final)


Hadoop 2.2.0
Subversion https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/common -r 1529768
Compiled by hortonmu on 2013-10-07T06:28Z
Compiled with protoc 2.5.0
From source with checksum 79e53ce7994d1628b240f09af91e1af4


hive-0.12.0

comments.body: Check for errors in the logs of the failed tasks. That can help identify the root cause.

Hive, will command "group by" explain to division method? or count(*)?

I don't use any division ,but why error "/ by zero" ?

I have resolve it.

It because my disk has no space, sometimes the disk clean and have a little space for job, it become sucess, and other times the disk has not enough space, so it become error.

But, why it show '/ by zero' when disk is full? will  the jobs distribution use division? This need someone other to explain it.
